----- Original Message -----
From: "Mark Baker" <distobj@...>

>
> BTW, a message where Mike Champion also misses the point in talking
> about firewalls, is here;
>
> http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-ws-arch/2003Jan/0321.html

> > "If an intermediary understands XML and SOAP, in can
> > be configured to use XPath or whatever to peek into messages and make
such
> > decisions.  Thus, *XML* allows "visibility"."
Why is introspecting the message body not 'visibility'?
An explosion of application meaning (lots of custom methods/operations) will
negate the benefit of visibility (being able to find the method/operation in
a message) - administration will become difficult.

>
> Please respond with any examples, or brief explanations, that you feel
> might help out.  Thanks!  I sense an opportunity here.  A couple of WG
> members are really close to getting it.
What is the 'it' that they should be getting? That visibility is good? Or
that visibility without a constrained interface gets you nowhere?
